Description: Textile fragment of one end of undyed, plain weave linen cloth with decoration; Seven small crosses in soumak brocading, in red and purple wool, each c.2x1cm, vertical bar ending in wedges, horizontal bar splayed; Symmetrical groups of weft self-bands (thicker yarns or groups of yarn used in one shed) occur 3 times; Warp: linen, S spun c.18 tpc; Weft: linen-S spun, c.12 tpc, wool-S spun, Z ply; Edges: plaited closing border (type X), warp threads initially Z twisted together in groups, parts of emerging groups of thread are knotted round bundles of short lengths of line thread to form a fringe of small tassles, other edges cut
Curator's comments: Previous location cupboard 64, blue box; Before burial probably domestic or liturgical cloth, not clothing; edges cut after excavation; Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (24.8.89)
Condition: Good; Unknown date stuck to sticky net
Acquisition notes: Collection purchased at sale on 6th Dec 1954, lots 154, 155 and 156.
